Francija zaostruje migracijsko politiko
06 Nov 2019, 15:11 by STA

Francija zaostruje svoj ton glede priseljevanja. “Nazaj si želimo pridobiti nadzor nad našo migracijsko politiko,” je danes dejal francoski premier Eduoard Philippe. Francija se bo v prihodnje borila proti zlorabi pravice do azila ter za uravnoteženje pravic in dolžnosti, poroča nemška tiskovna agencija dpa.



Foto: Andrej Guštin

PARIZ > Po zasedanju ministrskega odbora za migracijsko politiko je premier poudaril, da se mora Francija boriti tudi proti nezakonitemu priseljevanju.
Med drugim nameravajo okrniti zdravstveno zavarovanje za priseljence brez dokumentov. Begunsko divje taborišče na severovzhodu Pariza, v katerem živi do 3000 migrantov v zelo slabih pogojih, pa nameravajo izprazniti do konca leta. Že v torek je ministrica za delo Muriel Penicaud napovedala kvote za kvalificirano delovno silo iz tujine.
V prihodnje bodo hitreje izvajali deportacije, še vedno pa bodo sprejemali migrante, če ti izpolnjujejo pogoje, je poudaril Edouard Philippe.
V okviru ukrepov bo Francija okrepila razvojno pomoč za številne države. Kot je pojasnil premier, mora država pomagati pri premagovanju neenakosti v blagostanju po celem svetu.
Namerava pa francoska vlada do leta 2027 v državo privabiti pol milijona tujih študentov, da bi tako okrepila svoj mednarodni ugled.
Francija je trenutno peta država v svetu po sprejemu tujih študentov, a ji grozi upad. Predvsem Kitajska je okrepila strategijo za privabljanje študentov. V Franciji je trenutno 325.000 tujih študentov.

France tightens migration policy
06 Nov 2019, 15:11 by STA

France is tightening its tone on immigration. "Back we want to gain control of our migration policy," French Prime Minister Eduoard Philippe said today. In the future, France will fight against abuse of the right to asylum and to balance rights and obligations, German news agency dpa reports.



Photo: Andrey Gustin

PARIS> Following the Ministerial Committee on Migration Policy, the PM stressed that France must also fight against illegal immigration.
Among other things, they intend to shorten undocumented immigrant health insurance. A wilderness refugee camp in northeast Paris, home to up to 3,000 migrants in very poor conditions, plans to be discharged by the end of the year. Already on Tuesday, Labor Minister Muriel Penicaud announced quotas for skilled labor from abroad.
In the future, deportations will be carried out more quickly and migrants will still be accepted if they qualify, said Edouard Philippe.
As part of the measures, France will strengthen development assistance for many countries. As the Prime Minister explained, the country must help overcome wealth inequalities around the world.
However, the French government intends to attract half a million foreign students to the country by 2027 in order to strengthen its international reputation.
France is currently the fifth country in the world to receive foreign students, but is in decline. Notably, China has stepped up its strategy to attract students. There are currently 325,000 foreign students in France.
